meanings.definition: Enlist (someone) compulsorily, typically into the armed services.
meanings.sent1: The army had to conscript new soldiers during the war.
meanings.sent2: The government conscripted young men for military service.
meanings.sent3: When the aliens invaded, they tried to conscript cows into their army!
meanings.sent4: The storm conscripted the leaves, forcing them to dance in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The king's decree to conscript all able-bodied citizens echoed through the town.

meanings.definition: A person who has been conscripted.
meanings.sent1: The conscript trained hard to become a skilled soldier.
meanings.sent2: The conscript was proud to serve his country.
meanings.sent3: The conscript accidentally wore his uniform backward to the parade!
meanings.sent4: She felt like a conscript in the battle of office politics.
meanings.sent5: The conscript's determination shone brightly among his fellow soldiers.
